name: Daughter of Darkness
description: How people feel pretending to like music on the internet. Is this album haunting and eerie?? I'm not sure. I wasn't really even listening to this album, I was just doing shit and paying it no mind the majority of the time. Did they expect me to take a seat and listen to mysterious sounds for 7 hours straight? This just sounded like one long ass boring song that was intermittently interrupted by whatever sparkles sound like and some guy who sucks ass at yodelling. The only way this 'atmosphere' you guys are going on about is as pronounced as you say is if the atmosphere is me walking through a cold ass street for 7 hours with nothing to do as I slowly lose my fucking mind. Like I was kind of enjoying the atmosphere for the first 20 or 30 minutes but this shit just drains you, I felt tired after listening to this album. It is funny to see the Spotify views drop slowly as people get bored out of their minds listening to this. I think I'm going to get an early night.

name: For Long Tomorrow
description: God I hate math rock. Why did I give this a listen at all? Even then though, the album was pretty alright so I'm sure anyone who actually likes math rock would have a great time.

name: ÂÜÄË•øÂçóÊûóË∑ØË°å
description: Hello?? They got even better?? This album is borderline perfect. The lyrics, poetic. The instrumentals, incredible and even with a pinch of jazz that was absent from the previous project. The way they made the sounds of mining in songs like 'ÈááÁü≥'(The quarry) was absolutely awesome to hear and 'Ê≤≥ÂåóÂ¢®È∫íÈ∫ü' was so epic. Would be an 100 if track 3 didn't exist.

name: ‰∏áËÉΩÈùíÂπ¥ÊóÖÂ∫ó
description: I was loving this project and then 'ÊùÄÊ≠ªÈÇ£‰∏™Áü≥ÂÆ∂Â∫Ñ‰∫∫' came on and it was like what the fuck where have you been in my life before now??

name: ÈªëÂ§¢
description: Nothing bad about this project, it was good but could have been better with a few more exciting or interesting moments.

name: Short n' Sweet
description: It was alright but she clearly half assed some of this stuff just so she could make a full album and even then it's super short still.

name: The Moon Rising
description: Never heard any classical Chinese music but this shit sucks ü§ë ü§ë ü§ë üíØ

name: Wallsocket
description: Don't get this one at all, it's just kind of boring idk... Like it had some pretty great moments like 'Cops and robbers' and 'Johnny johnny johnny' but then the rest despite being loud and glitchy still just doesn't stick out at all.

name: FaeDads
description: God bless Youtuber musicians for making the most bland and uninteresting music of all time. Still not absolutely terrible, probably on account of its length but whatever.

name: Within the Depths of a Darkened Forest
description: Not really my thing, I like the ethereal dreamy vibes but it just feels a little empty, like it is missing something or could be doing more.

name: Bizarre Ride II the Pharcyde
description: Fun jazz-rap but just gets a little boring at points. The second half is a lot better though and kind of clutched up.

name: Cavalcade
description: Excellent at some points but what really brought it down was moments where the sound was so over the top and insane that my brain tapped out and stopped focusing on the music.

name: You Only Die 1nce
description: You're in your 40s dude you have to stop making gangsta rap üò≠üò≠

name: Pi√±ata
description: Loved Deeper, the rest was kind of hit or miss for me. Not bad by any measure though.

name: GMX
description: I'm pretty sure I'm holding Kendrick to a standard too high but I can't help myself. How can I not compare this to his masterpieces and while good, it's just kind of a let down? It felt empty in beats and raps. The title track also sucked ass and made me want to kill myself in a record breaking three minutes. God I hope my goat isn't washed but from where I'm standing this seems like the beginning of the end.

name: Deltron 3030
description: I know everyone loves this album but I can't for the love of me figure out why?? It's just kind of boring. All I have to say, not awful or even bad though.

name: Ants From Up There
description: Idk what Billie Eilish style is but bars. I can seriously listen to this album over and over and not get tired of it, everything is booming and grand, it's like being hit with a wave of sound but the wave sick as hell and it's awesome and super cool I think I'm losing my mind but this album is sick as hell please listen to this shit I was hooked by the second song it's totally worth your time.

name: Live at Bush Hall
description: Probably one of my favourite live albums of all time?? This album was effortlessly fire and is just a 3rd LP in my heart. My favourite song on here was predictably Turbines/Pigs, the building up into explosions of sound is just immaculate and the female singers cooks, she isn't a pig she's being too hard on herself :( . Very excited for these guys next work.

name: For the first time
description: Some of the tracks felt a little lacklustre especially compared to their later works but it was still a very good album, lots of bangers especially 'Science Fair', 'Sunglasses' and 'Opus'. It was a bit weird to hear Mr Road talking about Kanye, I don't know what that was about but I wonder if he too is as disappointed at Vultures as me.

name: The Joshua Tree
description: Was really enjoying the first few songs, kind of let down by the second half though which was nowhere near the level of the first and the last four songs lost this album a full two points from me.

name: Aja
description: Very good album up until 'I Got the News' which really pulled it up to an eight for me, that song is perhaps too smooth, impossibly so. Was a little disappointed that this wasn't 'The New Sound but less horny' like it was advertised but I got over that pretty quickly and just enjoyed this album for for it's endlessly funky jazz rock.

name: 3D Country
description: I thought I hated country because it was a bad genre, but it seems I hated country because nobody in the genre was doing it like Geese. This album is so fun and bullshit in the best ways possible. What I saw could make a dead man die is bars, ily Cameron Winter. The title track is my favourite off the album and a perfect song imho.

name: plastic death
description: A pretty great album that kind of started collapsing in on itself midway through but then seemed to hold off the collapse just well enough. The whole first half banged but the second was a little hit or miss for me though 'the CIA', 'commatose' and 'abyss angel' really clutched up and held this together. Especially commatose that song bangs so hard. The first half was incredible though with not a single miss.

name: Jackman.
description: I preferred him a lot more on Industry Baby and I think I will continue to only listen to him in Industry Baby.That's not because it's bad it's just because Industry Baby is that good. The actual album is alright, I liked 'They Don't Love It' the most but I really felt like this entire project Jack was just getting carried by his beats. I also feel like it needed to be longer than 22 minutes as it's not really a full album?? More like an EP idk.

name: From Zero
description: I'm sure people who love Linkin Park are loving this record, sadly I am not one of them and I just got bored out of my mind as this just felt like a rehash of older albums.

name: Mahashmashana
description: Good album, very beautiful but didn't really gripped me, except for in 'Screamland' and 'She Cleans Up' which both go hard, but Screamland more in a going hard way and She Cleans Up more in a very pretty way. I can't explain anything, listen to the songs if you want to get it.

name: Enter the Wu-Tang (36 Chambers)
description: Maybe I just don't get 90s hiphop but this stuff is so overrated and boring. Some guy told me to smoke while listening to it but I think if I was high I'd probably fall asleep by song two.

name: Illmatic
description: Just realised I forgot to rate it but this album put me to sleep Tyler was onto something.

name: Black on Both Sides
description: It's fun and an interesting listen both musically and lyrically. It's clearly a classic for a reason and I feel like it's aged much better than other 'classic' hiphop albums from the 90s like Illmatic or Enter The Wu-Tang.

name: I like the way you slit (join my cult 2)
description: Thank god this was only 15 minutes because I think any more and I would have gone insane. The mixing is totally fucked and it felt like my ear drums were being blown out once a second. It must be a purposeful decision but I don't know what purpose giving me a headache serves. Dogshit cover too.

name: Persona
description: A really fun album and automatic is an absolute banger.

name: SATURATION
description: Great debut album, a few songs like HEAT, TRIP and SWIM brought it down for me and the last song wasn't super satisfying either. I also thought the skits didn't really add anything but apart from that it's full of bangers, my favourites were 2PAC and FACE. Will be sure to listen to 2 and 3.

name: The End of Evangelion
description: Alright for ambience but listening to it as an actual album is so boring zzzzz how is this so highly rated.

name: Promises
artist: Floating Points, Pharoah Sanders & The London Symphony Orchestra
description: Perhaps too minimal? Like I know this thing is literally a post minimal album but holy shit I think I can feel that one harp string reverberating in my head and im going insane.

name: #SantanaWorld
description: It's alright but Tay K gonna rot in hell do not free this man.

name: Monarch of Monsters
description: I think I'd like this more if I didn't have to fight Apple music to listen to it. My favourite song was easily Pest, the guitar and whatever brass instrumental was playing at the start went so hard, but it just went downhill from there and it really hit it's lowest point on Sludge where to be honest the name says everything. It was a boring 20 minute slog where I at multiple points considered just turning the album off and then once it finally ended Revenge Fantasy started playing and that song was ass too üò≠ (not nearly as bad though). It seems like a lot of people got hit hard by this one but I just can't relate, perhaps I'm just a sheltered little whiteboy but this was far too hit or miss for me. By the way, was that a gmod sound effect on PLAY DEAD! PLAY DEAD!? I swear to god it was. When it comes out on Spotify I'll relisten to it and perhaps the pain of giving Tim Apple my credit card will have dissipated and I'll be able to enjoy it fully. Edit: Upon relisten I will not be changing my score, this album was just as mixed a bag for me as on first listen.

name: REACTOR
description: Not as good as chaser, though chaser is one of my favourite albums of all time so that'd be pretty hard. Despite that, this album had a real kick to it. I've loved Weightless, dinner and M3 N MIN3 since their first release and songs like IT'S TIME go crazy hard. I'd really love to have heard M3 N MIN3 for the first time on this album because hearing the Danny check was so hype. I'd like for more variety in femtanyl's next release as the formula is getting a little repetitive though I'll keep listening to her music even if she just does this forever she my goat fr. I also had Chromokopia queued by accident and the transition from IT'S TIME and Darling, I is pretty good.

name: Give Up
description: Lots of bangers but the second half really just faded into the background.

name: A Little Bit Of The Road or Something Like an Egg in the morning cracked over my head
description: üò≠üò≠üò≠

name: Trout Mask Replica
description: i spent like 10 straight minutes laughing at this shit how the fuck did this even happen. did he not let anyone hear this?? how did frank zappa give this the thumbs up? like who decided to put a fully spoken word 2 minute long section for the second song?? i literally felt like i was going insane listening to this shit, but i cant put an album that gave me this much joy before a 50, despite it deserving a 10. would never listen to this again though.

name: american dream
description: no its not the word lcd soundsystem album. its a step down for sure but it still has the same lcd soundsystem charm and oh baby is easily one of their best. the main issue with this album was some really disappointing last few songs, there did not need to be any 12 minute songs and the rest of the stuff was good but it just didnt blow me away like those on sound of silver or this is happening.

name: De Todas las Flores
description: the first song didnt click but it was smooth sailing from there, this is honestly one of the 'smoothest' (probably the wrong word) albums ive ever listened to so i can imagine myself returning often especially with all the great songs on here like the title track and maria la cuarandera. my only issue is that some songs weren't particularly memorable but that might be a language barrier thing.

name: Sound of Silver
description: my favourite lcd soundsystem record, its consistent, fun and every track is near perfect (except for the title track but that still goes hard). the final track was a complete curveball in the best way possible and everything else was just classic lcd soundsystem but at the highest level possible. you can tell just how hard this man laboured over every single song, they're layered but never have too much going on. all my friends is one of my favourite songs of all time btw. very excited to see what mr soundsystem has in store for me next.

name: LCD Soundsystem
description: just too many misses for me to love. songs like thrills, yeah and tired fuck the flow up really badly and honestly the entire disk 2 is a step down except for the first few songs. this does not need to be almost two hours though it could have done with half.

name: This Is Happening
description: for some reason i kept trying to this listen to this record and then getting bored by drunk girls, perhaps im sexist idk, but after i broke my mental barrier i was able to fully enjoy this. i slowly think mr system is becoming one of my favourite artists. of course dance yrself clean was the highlight but thats not to discredit all the other great songs on here, even somebody's calling me, which all the terminally online seem to hate was honestly great. it was very fun and if i was physically capable of dance i would've been throwing it back rn.

name: webcore friends
description: brain tumor music. i dont think i can see colours anymore after watching that music video either. aside from the loss of 10 years of my future life this is just some pretty generic sounding modern breakcore, or maybe digital hardcore idk but its surely not hardcore sounding enough and if im being honest at this point all the breakcore i hear this days forms some kind of homogeneous glob in my head and asking me to name a single song would be quite a challenge. it bores me to death and every song sounds like bright colours and autism.

name: Everywhere at the End of Time
description: just sounds like low quality old music to me and even if it didnt and im too tiktok brained to get through this long ass album. probably some life changing experience, too bad its too boring for me to listen to.

name: ORQU√çDEAS
description: i dont know enough spanish to listen to this. straight up. i know a bit of spanish, i could probably hold a conversation with a second grader but thats about my extent, so when she switches between spanish and english i feel like im having whiplash trying to figure out what shes saying because im not smart enough to understand the spanish sections without a lot of thought. i think ill relisten to this once im more literate and i imagine it will be better.

name: Cross
description: had some real bangers like DVNO and D.A.N.C.E but most of the time it just blends into the background. stress (the song but also the concept) was also just bad so that didn't help either. yeah im sure this was ahead of its time and groundbreaking but listening to it now i just dont think it holds up.

name: The Wall
description: the last pink floyd record in their legendary 70s run and its... underwhelming?? this album isnt bad, i actually like it but its just a bit overhyped. it has too many songs and has spread itself thin creatively which you can definitely notice in the second disk where songs start being really hit or miss. of course another brick in the wall (all parts) and comfortably numb are classics though. this is the donda of the pink floyd discography (i cant go a single minute without a kanye reference sorry).

name: Night Palace
description: this album took me like 5 tries to get into and i think it was worth it, some of this stuff is mystical, like straight up i felt like i went into a trance like state listening to co-owner of trees. might need to relisten with a focus on the lyrics as i have no idea why demolition turned into a podcast at the end but it was cool either way. the range of sounds on this album is quite honestly insane and the fact that they seem to work together is even more crazy. my main complaint was that yeah it just took me a while to get into, thats just because of my inexperience with mr eerie i think but still gonna hold it against him idk. also the album cover looks like dogshit literally every single cover looked better than this sorry phil. very rewarding album to listen to and i imagine my rating can only grow. sidenote spotify queued scary monsters and super creeps (the song not the album) after this album and the transition from i need new eyes to scary monsters and super creeps is scarily good.

name: Songs of a Lost World
description: Listened with my dad and him being pissed off that the songs were all like 6 minutes honestly made the experience way better. I was already impressed with 'Alone', but when 'And Nothing Is Forever' went on, holy shit I was going crazy. One of the best songs I've heard this year. The only low point on this one for me was Warsong and it was barely a low point. We are back team. Edit: 8.8 -> 8.4 This album has grown off me a little. I still think it's great but it's not hitting as hard.

name: Random Access Memories
description: Lots of great stuff especially Giorgio by Moroder, Giving Life Back to Music, Instant Crush, Touch and Get Lucky. A nice and very thematically satisfying send off for daft punk, but it just never really clicked for me, I've listened to this about three times now and its still just really hit or miss imo. I think this would be better if I was a bigger Daft Punk fan.

name: CHROMAKOPIA
description: Just finished this shit and WHAT THE FUCK WAS THE SECOND HALF. IM ACTUALLY TWEAKING SO MUCH WHATTTT. 'Like Him' had me floating and Balloon sent me fucking intersetellar. 'Take Your Mask Off' was also straight beautiful. Not much more to say but my goat is still alive and I'm so happy right now. Edit: 9.4 -> 9.7 This album has grown on me since release and I can't stop listening to it. The songs hit hard and go hard.

name: Eye To the Ear
description: Some of the stuff like 'Marvellous Clouds', 'I Did And I Don't And I Do', 'By Being With You' and 'Interdimensional' had me floating but I thought the majority of the center had very little to it and I ended up zoning out a bit. This was certainly interesting though, not sure if I've ever heard something quite like this before and I imagine it requires a certain mood to enjoy fully.

name: Voices From the True World VII
description: i feel like ive heard this same kind of sound too many times and it bores me at this point. it sounds like one of those 'credits song for my death but im the final boss' videos. at some points it almost just fades into the background but then randomly increases its intensity and reminds me of its existence which i didnt appreciate. crystal ice caves was a nice change of pace though, i enjoyed that one.

name: Rossz Csillag Alatt Sz√ºletett
description: really hated szerencestlen but it was smooth sailing from there. maybe its because right before i listened to a song from the genre 'harsh noise wall' and needed to cool off idk. i liked the classical moments a fair bit more than i expected and i enjoyed ongyikos vasanap and hajnal (especially hajnal that was fire) quite a lot and i thought the ending song was very pretty but a fair few of the songs just felt a bit redundant and id probably have enjoyed it more if it was a bit shorter but that might just be a skill issue, maybe ill need a relisten. some of this album kind of reminded me of Maigre by igorrr and ruby my dear which was cool.

name: I Hate Jazz
description: somebody buy this guy a working microphone please holy shit why does this sound like it was recorded on a microphone from the 1940s

name: The Lamb as Effigy
description: i like the slendermen on the cover but this album just hurts my ears. i like the first song 'man proposes, god disposes' but it just goes downhill from there until my ears are bleeding by the end. i literally had to take a break after margin for error because it was too much for me.

name: Joy as an Act of Resistance
description: this is just one of those albums that you listen to because the name gets caught in your mind. unironically one of the most fire album titles of all time right behind allelujah! dont bend! ascend! sadly the album doesnt match its titles coolness, in the second half at least. the first half is absolutely incredible which is the main reason for my score, the second half loses its steam a bit though, its by no means bad but it just doesnt go quite as hard.

name: Everything Is a Lot
description: music for people who try to pretend that they are unwell in the head. i wont believe youre truly insane in the head until you do something actually off the rails, kick a baby or sit outside a supermarket yelling slurs at strangers and then maybe ill believe you.

name: Flood
description: one of the og geek rock albums with not a single song thats bad and even has a couple classics just birdhouse in your soul and istanbul (not constantinople). umbrella academy actually got me onto this one (fun fact). your racist friend is a great song name btw.

name: Black Ben Carson
description: the first jpegmafia album and its... alright? it has some songs like all caps no spaces, drake era, the 27 club and the extremely disturbing i just killed a cop now im horny that show off peggys talents but most of this stuff ranges from average to alright.

name: Orgy of the Damned
description: blues rock was a mistake and should never have existed and this album is proof

name: Gris Original Soundtrack
description: absolutely incredible ost that really makes gris. unagi and gris, pt. 1 are some of my most listened to songs of all time on spotify and the rest are some very nice songs to just chill and listen to.

name: Three Cheers for Sweet Revenge
description: my favourite my chemical romance album and one of the last truly great pop punk albums

name: loveless
description: you can practically hear the cover, this is the kind of music you have to listen to with headphones because its just too layered to listen to on a shitty phone speaker or something. i honestly couldnt imagine hearing this in 1991, i would be losing my mind.

name: Trench 10 Inch Triplet EP
description: i dont get why people love this one so much. i thought nico and the niners was good but the other two were just alright.

name: The New Normal!
description: will is the gayest straight man alive. the production was there but it just felt like will wood was screaming at me to look at him showing me how wacky he is and shit and it came off as a little corny, though laplaces angel was pretty good and so was i / me / myself.

name: Ikiru
description: i used to pretend to like this one because it had young girl a on it which i thought was a banger, but most of this is boring and if im being real im not even if sure if i like young girl a that much anymore. this is like youtube music but not from the actual youtube music app, this is the kind of shit actual video youtube tries to get you to listen to.

name: NO THANK YOU
description: a pretty massive letdown from little simz. the entire last quarter was just straight bad and it felt like i could take or leave most of the stuff on here.

name: UTOPIA
description: i got this one recommended to me by a friend and i think its worn off me. i originally thought it was maybe a 7.5 but the more times i hear the songs the less interesting they sound. circus maximus, my eyes, looove and modern jam are really good but the rest is kind of weak at least for travis scotts standards. this could have done without a fair few of the songs.

name: ...Like Clockwork
description: people love this album, and i think i have an idea of why but its just clearly not for me. rock without any bonus flavours or over the top zesty production has never been a genre i really enjoyed, despite that i think i had a good time with this record. i appear missing is really great and my favourite on this by far.

name: RAMONA
description: firstly, fire ass cover. like this was literally the only reason i listened. ceres & calypso in the deep time levels of eye catching. this mixtape is such a strange amalgam of styles and the fact that they all actually sound good is quite the accomplishment. my favourite songs are the ones that lean more into a jazzy sound but the more lofi songs dont bore me like i often find they do. some of these songs even give me luv(sic) vibes which was pretty awesome, especially backwoods. good luck chuck was actually pretty disturbing too and a crazy curveball.

name: Patterns in Repeat
description: hmmm, auspicious. this might need a few more listens for me to get it fully and probably some more focus on the lyrics as i definitely felt like i wasnt getting the full picture at some points, though with its relatively short 36 minute length i imagine ill be listening to it again sooner rather than later. even without a deep understanding of the album during my first listen it was still kind of great?? im not really one for chamber music or folk so i dont really know how this weighs up in a comparison but this album certainly had me almost transfixed at some points, only being broken out of the immersion by track five and six which while not bad at all just seem to have a different vibe or something? i dont know i cant explain it. overall some great stuff and i think ill need to listen to some more laura marling in the future.

name: Cartoon Darkness
description: not that much to say about this one as i basically tuned it out after a point. it just kind of bored me and punk as a genre really does nothing for me.

name: The Angel, The Demon,
description: a very impressive synthpop project, why is the cover undertale fanart though? i think my main problem with this one is that its just too long. i think everything but the demon, lit fuse, [...] and the angel could have been cut out. not to say those songs are bad, in fact i really like all of them (except for redeyes that song really is bad) but [...] and the angel alone are an hour 15 minutes and i generally prefer shorter albums. maybe they could have been put in an extra ep or something. the thing that ruined redeyes for me was its really piercing noise playing over the like whole second half that of ruined the flow for me after a very good start with the demon. i know i really only said bad things about this album i actually did have a good time with this one and it deserves to be more popular than it is. go listen to this or at least listen to the angel pt. 1, that was majestic.

name: REBIRTH
description: after listening to fly enough to be virgil i was pretty excited and i think this met my expectations. i hope gets more attention because 15 ratings just makes me sad. my main issue with this though is that it seems to be a little all over the place but i imagine the new tyler album is gonna be all over the place too and im gonna meat ride that like crazy so this could grow on me. a lot of songs also just feel like nothing, like this would have been a much better 40 minute album. my favourite songs were spotlights and fly enough to virgil.

name: LYFESTYLE
description: i was talking to a friend about favourite musicians (because music is the only thing im capable of talking about ig). but they told me their favourite underground artist was yeat and ive been fuming ever since for no reason because im just a hater ig. anyways despite me coming in really wanting to hate this one i actually ended up liking it and its kind of insane that yeat made two albums that people liked in one year, very impressive output. my favourite song off this one was gone 4 a min and my least favourite was the summrs feature.

name: Moana
description: the people that dont like this are just mad they'll never be as glam as tamatoa

name: Goodbye Horses
description: id love to rate this lower but i cant deny the fact that the song goodbye horses was so good. like this entire album bored me into a coma and then goodbye horses started playing and that shit save my life fr. cant believe its sitting on a 64 user score. i dont know how he pulled it off but somehow for those three minutes this mf surpassed all his idols he was trying to imitate during this entire album it was insane trust.

name: Virgins
description: aside from live room, this album was just background sounds that im kind of impartial to, live room did catch me off guard though

name: Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts
description: went in knowing nothing, did not expect shoegaze but it was a pretty welcome surprise. i thought this one was really good especially on a white lake, near a green mountain where i could feel myself ascending to a higher plane or something. i might relisten at some point when my head doesnt hurt like hell though.

name: Melodrama
description: people in new zealand often try to pretend that the only good nz artist isnt lorde, claiming that 1814 or six60 are somehow on the same level as her. ive listened to six60, ive listened to 1814 (because spotify is shoving them down my throat) and they dont stand a chance, lorde could make dont forget your roots any day of the week but six60 could never make liability. this is easily one of the best synthpop albums of all time. im never going to listen to solar power they cant make me.

name: SABLE,
description: randomly realized this dropped, wasnt even waiting for it and i still get to listen to it before all you guys who are waiting i love living in new zealand so much. anyway this is actually pretty good, id like it to be a bit longer but its an ep so who really cares.

name: MG Ultra
description: this album is like a really long stride in the right direction after uvoid which was dogshit. like its still in the same vein as uvoid creatively but way more refined. still doesnt have the same level of autistic energy as because im young and arrogant. hot lizard is absolutely a banger though. this album felt a little more accessible too? like your grandad would probably still die if you played this for him but it would be only one stroke instead of three.

name: The Machinist - Demo 1
description: ehhh, the vocals are really quiet for some reason (maybe bad recording tools) and the yelling sounded forced

name: From the Circus to the Sea
description: some of the best tiktok music you can find

name: Sometimes I Might Be Introvert
description: this ablum sounds massive. idk music terms or anything but this felt like it was towering over me and just keeps growing somehow.

name: GREY Area
description: a bit of a let down to hear this right after sometimes i might be introvert but its still a great album with some especially great moments like selfish and venom

name: open til midnight
description: pretty classic starmoon, lots of random annoying and often painful sounds that are not needed at all and the actual substance sounds pretty awful too

name: Pent Up Pup - Live @ The Sex Room @ AC '24
description: banished from the sex room

name: Wild God
description: guys can we stop making great albums for like a couple days im having trouble keeping up here <--- this was written during augest when imaginal disk, romance, sky hundred, ultra 85, i lay down my life for you and shadow box dropped

name: Die Lit
description: i guess i just dont get carti, this is his highest rated project and it still only bordered on being good for me. there were some great moments like choppa wont miss but a lot just felt like bloat to me.

name: Fearless Movement
description: imagine getting an andre 3000 feature and its completely instrumental but still goes hard. thats just the kind of album this is and prologue is competing for my favourite song of this year, i wish this was a little shorter though because an hour 30 of jazz was a bit much for me.

name: Swimming
description: mmmm, id like to rate this one higher but there are just a lot of songs that i dont really vibe with but also jet fuel and come back to earth are some of my favourite songs in hiphop, if this only had those two it would probably be an 100 (i mean probably not because that would fuck up the flow but still you get what im saying)

name: Radio Songs
description: an almost offensively boring set of songs, i listened to this because it was from a member of blur but this is just sad

name: Man On The Moon: The End Of Day
description: i fear that im becoming a kid cudi fan. this album is just so catchy and fun and different from a lot of the hiphop i hear usually

name: The Black Saint and the Sinner Lady
description: surely one of my favourite jazz albums of all time, it has a great flow and is just really full. my major problem with this though is the mixing is so fucked like a lot of the 1960s stuff

name: The Magic Show
description: i dont know why people who are bad at making music default to ambient but im sorry an ambient album is not as easily as you think it is

name: A Love Supreme
description: this album is an overrated piece of shit that forced me to switch to mono because its got that annoying ass half in one ear half in the other thing going that gives me a headache. i read a bunch of reviews talking about how cinematic the album was and i just didnt feel that, it felt empty and bored me to death. the 40 points were mercy points.

name: Violator
description: i was sceptical at the start of world in my eyes, i was like 30 seconds in and felt like this album was gonna be dogshit but i was throwing it back by the end of it so i guess i know nothing. that was one of the best synthpop albums ive ever heard in my life, behind maybe just imaginal disk and melodrama (and maybe currents too but im still figuring out how i feel about that one). its like the old ass men in depeche mode were seducing me or something. the best song was either personal jesus or policy of truth and it was crazy when i realised ive heard enjoy the silence a bunch of times and just didnt know it was by these guys. blue dress was by far the worst song and kind of brought this album down a lot. that shit was way too long for its own good and so boring.

name: Crazy Hits
description: mind bending horrors beyond human comprehension

name: Bocanada
description: very fun pop?? dance?? rock?? album. my favourite songs were puente, verbo carne and raiz (especially raiz) and the worst song was y si el muno esta en foco by far. i think it had a bit of a weak second half.

name: The Mouse and the Mask
description: a great project that i somehow didnt know existed until today, this album is great but i feel like if anything doom actually brought it down, the beats were great but doom didn't seem to be on his a game. luckily dooms b game is better than most rappers a game. sofa king and old school rules were my favourite songs, especially sofa king that beat was fire.

name: NO TITLE AS OF 13 FEBRUARY 2024 28,340 DEAD
description: godspeed you black emperor seems to just make the same album over and over again and continue to get glazed for it. its alright but #3 of 2024? i dont think so.

name: Absolute Elsewhere
description: it was pretty great for a death metal album but it still didnt do much for me as most death metal albums do. i should probably stop listening to death metal but symbolic was just so good i have to keep searching for the next banger like that.

name: Twin Fantasy (Face to Face)
description: i dont get the appeal for these guys, maybe its because im not gay and not a furry but this album just never really clicked with me <--- edit 52 -> 54 on a relisten it seems i am still not a furry but slightly more gay

name: Tummyache
description: i might be getting tired of mr kaizo slumber. his songs are starting to all merge into one for me. still thought it was an alright sludge of music.

name: Brat and it's completely different but also still brat
description: yowch, first 136 ratings sitting a 79 (on aoty). probably a bad sign, even though album is worse than the original by a fair bit i still think its a good time and girl, so confusing featuring lorde is way better than the original and one of the best songs this year <--- actually edit i just heard the yung lean ft again and wow that song is dogshit im not even sure this is good <--- another edit, this has grown off me even more, mean girls is awful, so is so i, i might say something stupid and i think about it all the time. <--- last edit, third listen after i saw that somehow this had a critic score of 87 and it was even worse than the first two times. now i am fairly sure i enjoy this less than vultures two.

name: ‚ñì a desire ‚ñì
description: maybe i just dont get it but the whole first 10 or so minutes felt like just a continuous and painful stream of sounds which was pretty disorienting, if that was the point and if so good job. after that though i started enjoying it a lot more, it started sounding kind of mystical and ethereal which was a nice recovery period for my blown out ear drums though a desire part 1 went on a bit too long. in general i also think this album sounded perhaps a little uncoordinated too, though im no music reviewer so maybe that was me missing the point again lol. i think my favourite songs were untitled-++++++ (or sorrow / intermission) and untitled-+++++++++ (or nothing, version d / forgo), especially untitled-+++++++++ (or nothing, version d / forgo). that song went hard and pulled this thing up like a full point.

name: My Song
description: thanks geordie but this album is just alright. its a nice listen though it just didnt do anything i didnt expect or that interested me enough to move it out of the background.

name: „Å≤„Åæ„Çè„ÇäÁîªÂÉè (Himawari gazou)
description: after seeing thelemonbreadd's day one review of this i decided to check it out and over the past couple of days ive just let this run in the background while i study and im pretty sure my brain tuned it out after like an hour, i dont know why white noise is rated so highly but alright. the only times i really noticed it was when it got real repetitive during some sections that i just had to skip because i dont want to develop a brain tumour. none of the songs on here are good, just ranging between bad and mid.

name: Speedin' Bullet 2 Heaven
description: this album is absolutely dogshit, i never want to listen to this again and im not adding a single song to my playlist, and yet i still think it was good. this might have been the realist album ever made. i dont know how he did it but instead of making music this man put his soul into this shit and honestly it probably shouldnt even be considered an album because it feels like something very different, this is like a kid cudi horcrux.

name: Kaleidoscope
description: limbo goes so hard it is quite insane. the rest though feels just good, not great.

name: Toy
description: a clearly incomplete album that just got released so they could squeeze as much money as possible out of david. this album is a joke and straight mid.

name: Run the Jewels 2

name: By the Time I Get to Phoenix
description: a very odd and listen that took me a while to get but after quite a few relistens i actually kind of love this album, maybe its stockholm syndrome

name: resERECTION
description: how did he get carried by danny gonzalez bruh shit is ass

description: my favourite ambient album, it just feels like its holding me close or something, this is exactly what an ambient album is meant to be, great work. maybe i have to watch twin peaks at some point

description: i really liked this album but i think i would have liked it a lot more if there wasnt a 10 hour long build up to every song, also my mum has the vinyl which is pretty cool. <--- edit 82 > 95 grew on me quite a crazy amount, my least favourite song is still welcome to the machine but if im being honest its a banger too, this album is bullet proof and deserves the hype.

name: NONE OF THIS IS REAL
description: Brain tumor music.

name: drowning
description: Like it less than phoria, felt the first half was extremely weak but I was pleasantly surprised by the last two especially 'Home' which imo is the best song Ace of Spades has ever made, held back by the vocals. Tbh the vocals are easily the worst part of this project and dont mesh well at all with the often good instrumentals.

name: the art of aloneness
description: A nice cozy ambient album, didn't blow me away but was some good background noise to just forget about.

name: Velocity : Design : Comfort.
description: 'Dsco' and 'Chocolate Master' were the only good things on this, the rest was just a bunch of glitchy sounds that hurt my head. Edit: Dsco cannot carry this changing my score from 5.6 to 3.9. Edit 2: Knocking this from 3.9 to 2.9 it's just so bad I'm sorry.

name: CPU Buddha
description: I'm the consumer wojack I need more Digital hardcorH in my life please god how did only like three albums come out this year, also the cover is really cool, it's like a lake and then you look harder and its a CPU and its like holy shit.

name: Bitches Brew
description: I dont get the hype around this one because this album put me to sleep, even the parts I didn't like I couldnt put on a playlist or anything because all the songs were like 20 minutes long. Edit: Heard the first few songs again it was worse than I remembered, 3.9 -> 3.4.

name: Death & Rebirth
description: A genuinely good shoegaze EP by askuagender?? My only wish is that it was longer. 'Lies and Silence' might have been one of my favourite songs this year. Edit: Did this get wiped out of existence wtf happened??

description: Another 11 year old me classic, I think this one holds up a little better than Mild High Club and 'Swinging lynn still goes just as hard as i remember, it just suffers from too much filler.

I've even grown on some songs like Junya and Jonah which I originally thought killed the flow of the album. I imagine I'll come back to this album again and again after Kanye continues to ruin my life with dogshit.

name: To Pimp a Butterfly
description: iconic album and probably one of the best hiphop albums ever made. the cover is also sick. this is really short because honestly im not smart enough, american enough or black enough to correctly talk about it but all i can say is that your racist uncle wont be racist if you make him listen to this.

name: Igor
description: my favourite tyler the creator album and probably my favourite album ever. tells a story as well as having only bangers. the vinyl even has a secret song (boyfriend) which is fire and the cover really stands out, listen to it now.

name: The Money Store
description: this album got me drenched in sweat by the end of it. its like a gateway drug to more experiemental hiphop aswell as a gateway into crack. idk if id say you should buy this as the bdsm type cover probably wont leave a good impression on your friends and family.

name: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
description: best nicki minaj verse ever on monster, best rick ross verse on devil in a new dress and runaway is one of my favourite songs ever. listen to it if you havent yet. the album art is also iconic and recognisable so its pretty cool to have.

name: Ziggy Stardust and the Spider From Mars
description: basically perfect album in my mind. not a single miss, five years is a perfect start and rock 'n' roll suicide is the perfect final song. the cover is icon too, also undeniable proof david bowies from the future he predicted kanye west!!
